availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
STATE OF MISSOURI.
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL.
SALUS POPULI SUPREMA LEXESTO.
MDCCCXX
To His Excellency, Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned Governor of the State of Missouri, would inform your Excellency, that Alfred H. Hise in this State charged with the crime of Obtaining goods under false pretences (as will fully appear by the copy of an Affidavit of M. E. Martin hereunto annexed, which I certify to be authentic,) is a fugitive from the justice of this State, and now supposed to be within the limits of the State of Kentucky

Your Excellency is therefore requested, in conformity to the Consttution and a law of the United States, to cause the said Alfred H. Hise to be delivered to John ^George^ H Maguire who is appointed Agent to receive him, that he may be brought into this State, and dealt with as to law and justice may appertain.

figure.ab:
THE GREAT SEAL OF THE STATE OF MISSOURI
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL.
SALUS POPULI SUPREMA LEXESTO.
MDCCCXX

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have hereunto set my hand, and caused to be affixed the Great Seal of the State of Missouri. Done at the City of Jefferson, this 24th day of July in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and 62, of the Independence of the United States the 87th and of this State the 42nd

Missouri
Demand for A. H. Hise
Felony
Warrant Issd July 31. 1862
